subject: Cybersecurity
title: Honeypots: Traps for Hackers
description: A quick, practical guide to Honeypots: Traps for Hackers.

hook.text: Some servers exist only to be hacked. They're fake targets designed to lure attackers and study their methods.

buildup.text: Honeypots mimic vulnerable systems to attract attackers. Every interaction is logged, providing intelligence on.

discovery.text: Since no legitimate user should access a honeypot, any connection is suspicious by definition. Zero false positives.

twist.text: Project Honey Pot tracked spammers by publishing unique email addresses on web pages. When spammed, the source was revealed.

climax.text: Honeypots turn the tables: instead of waiting for attacks, defenders bait them and learn from the attacker's behavior.

punchline.text: The easiest system to hack was designed to be hacked.

quiz.question: What advantage do honeypots have over other detection methods?
options: Any connection to a honeypot is suspicious, giving near-zero false positives
